cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 315 mi (510 km) SE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving west across the central Caribbean, forecast to turn northwest late Sunday then north-northwest toward western Cuba and the eastern Gulf of Mexico, eventually approaching the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Cayman Islands; Tropical Storm Watch for Jamaica (no watches for Florida yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Jamaica, Cayman Islands, western and central Cuba, Florida Keys and eventually much of the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely at this time for Port Everglades (greater surge threat on Gulf coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (up to 45-55 mph gusts) Tuesday–Wednesday with a 44 % cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and 12 % chance of 50-kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side at this stage; higher surge risk lies on the west coast of Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands could bring 3–6 inches locally >4 inches beginning as early as Monday night, causing urban and flash-flood concerns
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, rough seas that may disrupt pilot boarding operations and cargo handling
